children.subject:
I’m taking it right now and there are a few things worth mentioning.


You won’t learn in depth about how one might generally utilize a database as a software engineer. You also won’t learn extensively about the latest and greatest in databases (although this is true for any class really).


You will learn about how the internals of a database works from the SQL client all the way down to the storage components. You will learn how data is handled intelligently and the trade offs when discussing optimizations. You will learn the fundamentals necessary so you can generalize what you have learned to what is used today. 


Regarding its usefulness for SWE, other than databases being pretty much everywhere, I would say it’s pretty useful from the stand point that a few companies I’ve spoken to over the past couple weeks have been fairly intrigued by the term project in the course.

history.content: In your experience was CS186 extremely useful for full time SWE roles and is it something I should take before I graduate? I am enrolled right now in CS182 which I think is interesting but probably won't use in my job so I was wondering if I should drop it and take 186 instead.
history.subject: Is 186 needed for SWE jobs in industry
